solution_line_template: Each city arrest {protest_days}*{arrests_per_day}=<<{protest_days}*{arrests_per_day}={arrests_per_city}>>{arrests_per_city} people during the protest
So a total of {arrests_per_city}*{number_of_cities}=<<{arrests_per_city}*{number_of_cities}={total_people_arrested}>>{total_people_arrested} people were arrested
They spend {days_in_two_weeks}/{sentence_half_divisor}=<<{days_in_two_weeks}/{sentence_half_divisor}={sentence_days_spent}>>{sentence_days_spent} days of their sentence in jail
So they spend a total of {sentence_days_spent}+{days_before_trial}=<<{sentence_days_spent}+{days_before_trial}={total_days_in_jail_per_person}>>{total_days_in_jail_per_person} days in jail
So there was a total of {total_people_arrested}*{total_days_in_jail_per_person}=<<{total_people_arrested}*{total_days_in_jail_per_person}={total_jail_days}>>{total_jail_days} days in jail
So they spent {total_jail_days}/{days_per_week}=<<{total_jail_days}/{days_per_week}={total_jail_weeks}>>{total_jail_weeks} weeks in jail
